content:
Citymapper is a fantastic app that can help you optimize your daily commute and encourage you to walk more. It's a popular app among city dwellers, and for good reason! With Citymapper, you'll have access to real-time information on public transportation, including bus and train schedules, delays, and service alerts. You can use it to plan your route, track your journey, and even get alerts when you need to transfer or get off at your stop.

By using Citymapper to track your walk from the bus stop to your office, you'll be able to see exactly how much time you can save by getting off the bus earlier and walking. You might be surprised at how much time you can shave off your commute just by walking a few extra blocks! And, as you mentioned, it's a great way to get more exercise and reduce your reliance on public transportation.

Citymapper also has a feature called "GO" which allows you to track your journey in real-time, it will give you step-by-step directions and even alert you when you need to turn or transfer. It's very useful for walking routes as well.

Additionally, Citymapper has a feature called "Calorie Tracker" which estimates the number of calories you burn while walking, so you can track your progress and stay motivated to walk more.

Remember to also take advantage of Citymapper's other features, such as the ability to save your favorite routes and trips, and receive personalized recommendations for alternative routes based on your travel habits.

I think you'll find that Citymapper is a valuable tool in helping you achieve your goal of walking more and taking the bus less. Good luck, and happy walking!
